intro: Castilleja stenantha subsp. spiralis, commonly known as the spiralleaf Indian paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its showy, red-orange bracts that resemble paintbrushes. The plant has reduced leaves and relies on nearby host plants for water and nutrients. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its blooming period occurs in the spring and early summer, attracting pollinators with its vibrant floral display.
